mods.note: John W. Gurley, an attorney of New Orleans, Louisiana, was associated with Edward G. Stewart, a planter of Oak Lawn Plantation, Tangipahoa Parish, La. Stewart was a former resident of New Orleans. Gurley and his wife, Rosa, were registered as being enemies of the United States during the Civil War but were excused after they signed oaths of amnesty.
